Title: Sales order double entry Inonet read only
RMA move message
Description:
So when boards are moved into certain buckets, like Holdand DM Cart, the folks on this mailing list get an email with the explanationas to why. For normal production orders, the assembly number isself-explanatory, and I can move or delete emails for boards that aren’t for mycustomers.

But for RMAs, we need the decoder ring from WIPTracking. R122357 =

Would it be possible to add the part number of the itemnext to the shop order in the automated emails? Like this:

1 of R122357/ R06710 moved from B1 FQA to B1 HOLD by DENISE BONDY becauseNEED PICK TICKET & SERIAL CERT OVER RIDE, DB 10/27/20.

I ask because today Denise moved three RMA shop ordersinto hold because she’s waiting for the pick ticket (marketing) and the serialcert override (engineering). She normally does email a reminder to theengineer with this request. In this case, all three boards were for SAFTso I don’t do those overrides anymore.

But say this was one of mine and Denise forgot to sendthe reminder. It would sit there longer than it needs to.

Thank You,

Richard Wojtaszek

x278 or (570) 321-6278

Title: QinetiQ Document Automation
Description:
I would like to discuss the possibility of having someone work on a project for one of our customers (QinetiQ). Currently we hand fill all forms and we are seeing a higher than acceptable non-conformance rate in both Test and IPQA/FQA where the majority of the documentation completion is being completed. The project would be similar to the “MOOG Docs” program that we have used for test documentation in the past. What would you, or whomever would be working on the project, need to review the potential for designing the program? The customer does have specific forms that they require us to use, I have attached samples of them for you to review. We actually have several assemblies that I would like to set this up for. So far there are a total of 4 assemblies, but there are an additional 5 assemblies that I would like to include as part of the project. Of the attached forms you will see all are typically the same from assembly to assembly with the exception of Appendix F. The only difference to the forms is the customer has their test procedure listed at the bottom of each page.

This project is not customer approved yet, but I would liketo get information around to present to them for review andconsideration. They in turn would need to get acceptance from theircustomer before we could fully move forward with the project.

Please let me know what questions you have or any additionalinformation you would need to bring this project in to realization.

Title: CFE Database--Make Program entry menu only
Description: https://support.primus-tech.com/helpdesk/WebObjects/Helpdesk.woa/wa/TicketActions/view?ticket=18283 The Add Equipment feature is allowing typed in Program names. It should only allow menu choices. Example: CFEL00915. Program choice should have been "GOODRICH, VT" from the menu. Instead, the USER creating the record apparently typed in "GR-VT PB REQUIRED" . From the A-number entered in DESCRIPTION, our TEST MATRIX confirms my suspicion that the Program is indeed "GOODRICH, VT". There is little harm done, but it fowls up queries when our Collins customer rep requests a list of all Collins assets. Normal procedure is to list all programs containing the string "GOODRICH" but this skips CFEL00915. I suggest also adding a pop-up message stating "If none of the menu choices are appropriate, contact the customer rep for the program and get a new program name. Then IT will add that program to the menu." Please, at least disallow typed-in Programs. That should not be a difficult fix, and if we still have software support, I know we can tackle more difficult tasks. Thanks! Maybe this is no longer an issue? I haven't tried to type in a Program when I add a CFE.

Title: FDTN Tag ID
Description:
FDTN, more specifically the Tag ID test status subsystem in FDTN, has a few issues I would like to address in this email to help retain as much traceability as possible when it comes to defect handling.

Primarily when a tag ID is put into assignment, we are only capable of selecting one party.

In the event we have a single assembly that has an SMT component placed on the board upside down (leads in the air) as well as a hand soldered component with unsoldered leads we are unable to accurately record the defect root causes. We would need to be able to allocate each individual defect code added to a tag ID during diagnosis to ensure SMT isn't being blamed for hand solder and vice versa.

I'm not sure if the implementation of Aegis will come packing these upgrades, but to ensure defects are being accurately recorded I believe this should be added to our FDTN system, whether it be under the name Production Quality Control System or Aegis.

Title: Cash Requirement Report - Macola report to excel
Description:
User story: CFO requesting that this report be provided in excel instead of PDF. Business PROCESS:AP payments need to be requested and approved by CFO each week. Pull a cash requirement report ( with whatever cutoff date / often same as payment date ) Send to CFO; uploaded on COR drive. Convert this report to excel: Background information on report:

Cash Requirements Report

Use the Cash Requirements Report to determine which invoices can be paid with the available cash or to determine exactly how much cash is required to bring your A/P to a certain level.

For example, the report tells you exactly how much cash would be required to pay off all invoices due up to a certain date (called the cutoff date).

One important use for this report is to help you choose a suitable cutoff date (due date through which to pay invoices) for Generalized Payment Selection. Generalized Payment Selection is part of the Payment Preparation option, which allows you to automatically select invoices for payment. The cutoff date used in Generalized Payment Selection determines how many vendor invoices are selected for payment. Running the Cash Requirements Report with a given cutoff date shows you the total cash that is required if that cutoff date is used in Generalized Payment Selection. If the total cash required is too high, the cutoff date can be moved back. If the cash required is lower than available, the cutoff date can be moved forward.

The Cash Requirements Report does the following:

  • It itemizes the totals by vendor and, if you choose, it details vendor invoices as well.

  • It shows any discounts available on past due and current invoices as well as discounts lost because the invoice was not paid by the discount date.

  • It shows discounts now available that would be lost if the voucher is paid on the next payment date. These are shown as optional invoices.

When the cash required versus the discounts gained and payments made is correctly optimized, the Generalized Payment Selection can be run, using the same cutoff date. Any needed manual adjustments to these selections can then be made, and you are ready to print checks.

Form:
Detail report:


Development request:
Required columns:
Vendor no
Vendor Name
Terms
Invoice No
Voucher
Inv-Date
Due date
past due - don't need might add
current- don't need might add
net amount
purchase order if possible - usually 1 to 1 purchase order to invoice/voucher

Parameter for cutoff date that trims the records by due date. Solution: SSRS report; saved as excel. Ticket: (6) #10093, PPVAP Cash Requirements Query (spartronics.com)

Title: ESD Items Database
Description: <div style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;color:rgb(17, 17, 17);font-family:Arial, Verdana;font-size:13px;">A database with segregates for ESD carts, ESD smocks, and maybe shelving. An Audit finding is requiring us to periodically verify the integrity of mobile carts (ground < 1E9 ohms to ground) and ESD smock used for static control, not for personal grounding, (<1E11 ohms sleeve-to-sleeve). The attachments show what information is too be recorded for mobile carts and for static control garments. I didn't make a list of fields for shelving but it would be the smallest table.<br style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;"> <div style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;color:rgb(17, 17, 17);font-family:Arial, Verdana;font-size:13px;">There are other things in S20.20 that may eventually need to be periodically verified, so an ESD database should be scalable. I don't know if it is practical to have a database for every ESD item (one for carts, one for smocks, etc.) or to have one ESD database that can accomodate whatever we have to verify.<br style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;"> <div style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;color:rgb(17, 17, 17);font-family:Arial, Verdana;font-size:13px;">Bottom line is: paper records get lost, Excel is not practical, the Calibration Database has little in common with ESD fields that we need to record.<br style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;"> <div style="box-sizing:border-box;outline:0px;color:rgb(17, 17, 17);font-family:Arial, Verdana;font-size:13px;">Can we do this and what is the development time? I can begin with paper records but need assurance that the data will be moved to a database. I might still have paper records for doing the first 50 carts in 2019, or else they are already lost.

Title: Xray loader upload issue
Description: From Bill Ely Background - XRF (Xray Fluorescence) readings are exported to the DMR System via a "XRF Loading" program identified by the RR#, the unique receiving number assigned from Macola when the material is received in. The RR#'s in Macola are sequentially assigned from 1 - 999999. Primus reached 999999 several years ago and the sequence restarted at RR# 000001. The DMR System data was archived to prevent repeat RR# from corrupting the historical data. Problem - For the XRF loading program, the repeat RR#'s are now appearing under unintentional part numbers. For example, RR#'s 51622600 and 51642800 were originally received in 2009 but the readings are now showing up under circuit board part numbers that do not require XRF measurements but have the same RR#. I would suggest archiving the XRF data but providing a means to view the original data - perhaps in the DMR Archive Program. ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus (spartronics.com) Xray loader issue

Title: Supplier portal Quarters
Description: ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus (spartronics.com) Please change the frequency of the supplier scorecards to quarterly instead of monthly. Current report has columns for monthly. Want to change it to a quarterly to make it meaningful data. Not interested in an extract to make own data.

Title: CFE Program new field
Description:
Program names (Customer names) in CFE Database are sometimes no longer correct. Program Managers often need a list of that a customer's equipment at Williamsport. Since it is not always clear which division of a corporation is the correct program, we need to see a list of existing choices. There seems to be no way to send a list to a program manager or engineer. The only way I know to make the list appear is to click on ADD CFE and pull down the PROGRAM menu. I cannot make snips of the list because it disappears. There may be a way to easily list them and if so, I need to be instructed. Otherwise please make it a new feature. Thanks

Example of the difficulty: Goodrich has 4 menu items and is somehow associated with Kidde, UTAS, and Collins. To clarify who owns what, people need to see all the availble choices. I would like to send the complete list to associated Program Managers to see what needs to be renamed, merged, added, or deleted.

How can the list of PROGRAMS be sent in a file without typing every one?
Thanks
#15024, Add PRODUCTS field to CFE Database. (spartronics.com)

Title: Remove SO from reports
Description: please remove "Shop Order" field from print window. (5) ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus (spartronics.com)

Title: XRF Readings Wrong - Repeat RR Numbers
Description: Background - XRF (Xray Fluorescence) readings are exported to the DMR System via a "XRF Loading" program identified by the RR#, the unique receiving number assigned from Macola when the material is received in. The RR#'s in Macola are sequentially assigned from 1 - 999999. Primus reached 999999 several years ago and the sequence restarted at RR# 000001. The DMR System data was archived to prevent repeat RR# from corrupting the historical data. Problem - For the XRF loading program, the repeat RR#'s are now appearing under unintentional part numbers. For example, RR#'s 51622600 and 51642800 were originally received in 2009 but the readings are now showing up under circuit board part numbers that do not require XRF measurements but have the same RR#. I would suggest archiving the XRF data but providing a means to view the original data - perhaps in the DMR Archive Program. (12) #13556, XRF Readings Wrong - Repeat RR Numbers (spartronics.com)
